channel.title: Replacing stalls
channel.description:
As you might know, many servers have stalls at home to set people off and/or to make money. Well I'm going bored of this, so I thought why not have something like the stalls that also alternatively gains a level, for instance mining a rock that gives random gems. Another one would be a tree giving what ever... so yeah tell me what your idea is!
Oh yeah, and don't come on here saying, you don't need any of that just delete it all and use primary skills. I can do that, but I don't want to. Why? because I can just add a counter (as to how many times a rock can be mined or something).
-Thanks.

item.title: Replacing stalls
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

I know Tutorial but that’s why we people are called developers so they can develop these ideas over time unlike most things where it’s done in 1-2 hours

Read full topic

item.title: Replacing stalls
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:2, topic:519470”]who says you can’t get “dirt” from mining? In reality you rarely “strike gold”

I never liked how woodcutting was purely “to get logs” people also cut logs for paper etc. Some people do woodcutting for a business in real life even that would be cool but would probably take a lot of memory…xml or not

i never liked how farming was so biased on something you grow. farming is a way of life. i never thought it really showed the abstract idea itself but just a simple format. There is hoeing, fetilizing plants, and etc. compost “helps to protect” but there isn’t anything that really"makes it the good stuff"

i never liked how smithing was always based on “bar making” and “armor making” it should also qualify for home metal work such as crafting keys, making metallic forms of transport ( horse and buggy with woodcutting combined?)

the limits of the skills are endless[/quote]
The problems with suggestions such as those are they are too complex, in development and actual game-play.

Read full topic

item.title: Replacing stalls
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:

I never liked how woodcutting was purely “to get logs” people also cut logs for paper etc. Some people do woodcutting for a business in real life even that would be cool but would probably take a lot of memory…xml or not

i never liked how farming was so biased on something you grow. farming is a way of life. i never thought it really showed the abstract idea itself but just a simple format. There is hoeing, fetilizing plants, and etc. compost “helps to protect” but there isn’t anything that really"makes it the good stuff"

i never liked how smithing was always based on “bar making” and “armor making” it should also qualify for home metal work such as crafting keys, making metallic forms of transport ( horse and buggy with woodcutting combined?)

the limits of the skills are endless[/quote]
In short: #makeskillsrealistic
